body:
jason and dgk. jason was the biggest poweruser before the reddit exodus, and he got banned for "doxxing" bardfinn, *who already published their name anyway*. So in reality, it wasn't dox, it was the admins' excuse to get rid of jason. Not necessarily deliberate, but I think they made an extremely biased decision.

DGK was similar. He was given write access to ruqqus on github, so he said so on his profile. However, he had arguments with the admins, so they removed him from that, and because he didn't remove it from his profile that very millisecond, they *permanently* banned him for "staff impersonation" and refused to accept any appeal whatsoever. That was his first offense afaik.

post.body:
I've noticed an email in my inbox about changing ruqqus' ToS. It said that the webapp is changing their rules tomorrow.
In my opinion the freedom for a service holder to change their ToS is a bad thing, because it is a highway to become twitter or reddit.
There **are** necessary changes for ToS, e.g. on law changes, but these ToS update is to the case.
Yes, I know that Ruqqus LLC is a private company and muh, they litteraly can do anything and if you don't like, do it yourself! But then
how does ruqqus is different from reddit?
I hope capitainmeta4 won't use his power too much.

body:
> Not one person on this planet is good at everything, they may be able to portray it that way, but it's an act. People want to show themselves in the best way possible and they'll go through a lot of effort to make it seem like they're some sort of superhuman, but they aren't, not even close.

Yeah, you can't do everything, but you can do the things you put effort into, unless you're me. And it's not an act, because I've watched them do things effortlessly many times.

> very few people do

Evidently not, since everyone but me is doing it.

> Persistence is key to a lot of things and I know you say you don't believe it but it can really help you become more comfortable with something you had no concept of at all beforehand.

Comfortable yes. Better no.

> Stick to it, and pedal on at your own pace.

You're assuming I'm moving at all. This is my ceiling. I know that's hard to believe, but my progress has stopped.

> they're trying so hard to make themselves look good.

Some of them may be, but I know a lot who aren't, and I can tell that they're truly not. And even the ones who are still have to be able to do the things to look good.

parent.body: You'll probably dismiss what I say because you've heard it before, and that's fine, but it's the truth. Not one person on this planet is good at everything, they may be able to portray it that way, but it's an act. People want to show themselves in the best way possible and they'll go through a lot of effort to make it seem like they're some sort of superhuman, but they aren't, not even close. Now as for what you can do to help yourself: I'd recommend just doing some things for fun, try different things out and see how it goes. Don't worry about if people seem better than you or if you're not grasping things immediately, very few people do. Persistence is key to a lot of things and I know you say you don't believe it but it can really help you become more comfortable with something you had no concept of at all beforehand. Stick to it, and pedal on at your own pace. Don't worry about what other people are doing, because in their heads, they're trying so hard to make themselves look good.
parent.body_html: You'll probably dismiss what I say because you've heard it before, and that's fine, but it's the truth. Not one person on this planet is good at everything, they may be able to portray it that way, but it's an act. People want to show themselves in the best way possible and they'll go through a lot of effort to make it seem like they're some sort of superhuman, but they aren't, not even close. Now as for what you can do to help yourself: I'd recommend just doing some things for fun, try different things out and see how it goes. Don't worry about if people seem better than you or if you're not grasping things immediately, very few people do. Persistence is key to a lot of things and I know you say you don't believe it but it can really help you become more comfortable with something you had no concept of at all beforehand. Stick to it, and pedal on at your own pace. Don't worry about what other people are doing, because in their heads, they're trying so hard to make themselves look good.

post.body: I HAVE FUCKING HAD IT! NOT **ONE** OTHER PERSON HERE HAS A SINGLE FAULT EXCEPT FOR ME! I can't do anything right. Even the smallest things I try to do fall apart immediately, and everyone else just keeps moving along achieving pretty much anything they want if they set their mind to it. Sure, they fail some, but at least not all the time! And I've had it with everyone trying to sugarcoat it and make it seem like it's not a big deal, because it is. Whenever there's any kind of group project or organization, guess who's the only one not invited every single time? You guessed it, it's me! And they're not bullying me, it's because they know at a subconscious level that I'm not worth the dust beneath my paws, even the ones who have tried to deny this know it, and their actions prove it. Stop lying to me, the evidence is right in front of all of us! Not one thing I attempt ever finishes, and even if it would it'd be a huge mess and so much less than everyone else can do in a fraction of the time and effort. Now you may say, "Oh, I couldn't do what you did!". But you've never tried or been interested have you? Exactly. I don't and can't do even *one thing* halfway decently. Don't give me that 10000 hours crap or whatever, it hasn't worked at all for me and no one else even needs it. It's a myth, and even science has proven that, along with common sense. Practice accounts for maybe 0.1-10% of the difference, the rest is just innate intelligence that you have to be born with, not a fucking thing you can do about it. And everyone here has that in every field except me! I don't even know *one* other person who has this problem, I'm completely alone. Here everyone else is doing all sorts of crazy things and I can't even find a fox picture on the internet after searching for 2 hours with years of experience. I'm always out of the loop, super dull, can barely even think. I do a few things somewhat well but I'm faking it. They consist of a few specific things I've seen other people do and copying it robotically, with literally no understanding. I literally can't do *anything* else. Everyone else can at least do the thing they've been doing all the time for years, usually more than that, but me, nope, not even mediocre at one fucking thing! Not one hobby, not one game, not one subject, nothing! I'm uncharismatic, dull, forgetful, and just utterly incompetent! I'm a born loser, a wannabe in every way, and I just don't know how to play these cards! I get nothing but frustration and failure. This is so fucking unfair! The only thing I'm good at is burdening people with my problems. I used to have a some creativity at least when I was young but of course that went away as I got older and went through puberty and I can't ever even have that back! Damnit, what am I ever going to do with this situation! If I only knew even one other person on the whole planet who could sympathize with me. But no, you're all perfect and flawless and have superpowers compared to me, in real life and online. I need to give up on everything, my every effort is 100% in vain. But I'm not a passive consumer, and I can't just do that! Why am I like that when I don't have what it takes? I have no peace with myself, I can't just accept it, I don't want to waste my whole life in this miserable state. Someone please help me, I am falling apart! And please don't try to feed me more sugarcoated politically correct nonsense, that is not helping! Please, is there anything I can do escape this frustration and have joy in life?

body:
I don't think it's a learning disability, I can learn to copy other people like a robot just fine. I think it's that I'm just stupid and can't think for myself. But unfortunately most people think I'm really smart because they never bothered trying the things I did. But if they did they'd instantly zoom past me. Out of those who *do* have any interest, even mild, I'm always the lowest of the low. And it bothers me because I want to do things, mostly just for myself, and I can never get anything done but hours of frustration. And everyone else does it all the time just fine, usually well enough that it looks professional to me. And it takes a fraction of the time it does me.

> Like, you can't choose any of them or what?

I can't even find new ones at all, something everyone else in +foxes does multiple times a day with zero effort. And even when I do then I can't make up a good title because my brain doesn't work.

And everyone else does it all the time just fine, usually well enough that it looks professional to me. And it takes a fraction of the time it does me.

Like, you can't choose any of them or what?

I can't even find new ones at all, something everyone else in +foxes does multiple times a day with zero effort. And even when I do then I can't make up a good title because my brain doesn't work.

parent.body:
> I can't even find a fox picture on the internet after searching for 2 hours with years of experience.

Like, you can't choose any of them or what?

Have you tested or some sort of learning disability or whatever else? I imagine knowing what's wrong with you could help in overcoming it. IF it's *really* as bad as you say. Because from experience, I know you tend to be a lot harsher on yourself than you deserve to be during the depressed moods. Everyone's just kinda faking it through life.

post.body: I HAVE FUCKING HAD IT! NOT **ONE** OTHER PERSON HERE HAS A SINGLE FAULT EXCEPT FOR ME! I can't do anything right. Even the smallest things I try to do fall apart immediately, and everyone else just keeps moving along achieving pretty much anything they want if they set their mind to it. Sure, they fail some, but at least not all the time! And I've had it with everyone trying to sugarcoat it and make it seem like it's not a big deal, because it is. Whenever there's any kind of group project or organization, guess who's the only one not invited every single time? You guessed it, it's me! And they're not bullying me, it's because they know at a subconscious level that I'm not worth the dust beneath my paws, even the ones who have tried to deny this know it, and their actions prove it. Stop lying to me, the evidence is right in front of all of us! Not one thing I attempt ever finishes, and even if it would it'd be a huge mess and so much less than everyone else can do in a fraction of the time and effort. Now you may say, "Oh, I couldn't do what you did!". But you've never tried or been interested have you? Exactly. I don't and can't do even *one thing* halfway decently. Don't give me that 10000 hours crap or whatever, it hasn't worked at all for me and no one else even needs it. It's a myth, and even science has proven that, along with common sense. Practice accounts for maybe 0.1-10% of the difference, the rest is just innate intelligence that you have to be born with, not a fucking thing you can do about it. And everyone here has that in every field except me! I don't even know *one* other person who has this problem, I'm completely alone. Here everyone else is doing all sorts of crazy things and I can't even find a fox picture on the internet after searching for 2 hours with years of experience. I'm always out of the loop, super dull, can barely even think. I do a few things somewhat well but I'm faking it. They consist of a few specific things I've seen other people do and copying it robotically, with literally no understanding. I literally can't do *anything* else. Everyone else can at least do the thing they've been doing all the time for years, usually more than that, but me, nope, not even mediocre at one fucking thing! Not one hobby, not one game, not one subject, nothing! I'm uncharismatic, dull, forgetful, and just utterly incompetent! I'm a born loser, a wannabe in every way, and I just don't know how to play these cards! I get nothing but frustration and failure. This is so fucking unfair! The only thing I'm good at is burdening people with my problems. I used to have a some creativity at least when I was young but of course that went away as I got older and went through puberty and I can't ever even have that back! Damnit, what am I ever going to do with this situation! If I only knew even one other person on the whole planet who could sympathize with me. But no, you're all perfect and flawless and have superpowers compared to me, in real life and online. I need to give up on everything, my every effort is 100% in vain. But I'm not a passive consumer, and I can't just do that! Why am I like that when I don't have what it takes? I have no peace with myself, I can't just accept it, I don't want to waste my whole life in this miserable state. Someone please help me, I am falling apart! And please don't try to feed me more sugarcoated politically correct nonsense, that is not helping! Please, is there anything I can do escape this frustration and have joy in life?

body:
You misinterpreted that part. I honestly haven't really changed in attitude from when I was a child. That ability just went away, and it's not something I gave up, believe me I'd take it back in a heartbeat if I could. But it's not attitude or choice that made it happen, it's a very common and well-known phenomenon and has to do with changes in the brain as you go through puberty. When you're young, it's primed to imagine things and play more so it can learn and absorb information. But when you hit adolescence it changes to be optimized more for logic and rational thinking (which I'm not good at either), so your creative side takes a big hit. It's not something I chose to go through, I'd love to reverse it, but I can't.

And please don't misquote the Lord. If you look at the rest of the passage it's about humility, not literally mimicking everything children do. By that logic we should lie and cheat and steal because children do that naturally like all people. Be careful, bible "verses" are a trick of the very same person who plotted this whole setup to make me feel sub-par so that I would envy and become ungrateful.
body_html:
You misinterpreted that part. I honestly haven't really changed in attitude from when I was a child. That ability just went away, and it's not something I gave up, believe me I'd take it back in a heartbeat if I could. But it's not attitude or choice that made it happen, it's a very common and well-known phenomenon and has to do with changes in the brain as you go through puberty. When you're young, it's primed to imagine things and play more so it can learn and absorb information. But when you hit adolescence it changes to be optimized more for logic and rational thinking (which I'm not good at either), so your creative side takes a big hit. It's not something I chose to go through, I'd love to reverse it, but I can't.

And please don't misquote the Lord. If you look at the rest of the passage it's about humility, not literally mimicking everything children do. By that logic we should lie and cheat and steal because children do that naturally like all people. Be careful, bible "verses" are a trick of the very same person who plotted this whole setup to make me feel sub-par so that I would envy and become ungrateful.

parent.body: Turn to the Lord Jesus Christ.  If you recognize that you had positive traits as a child then you must admit that you have the capacity to accomplish things.  Jesus said: except you humble yourself as a child, ye shall in no wise enter into the kingdom of heaven.  So not only would Jesus suggest you return to as you were as a child, but it's a requirement.

Even the smallest things I try to do fall apart immediately, and everyone else just keeps moving along achieving pretty much anything they want if they set their mind to it. Sure, they fail some, but at least not all the time! And I've had it with everyone trying to sugarcoat it and make it seem like it's not a big deal, because it is. Whenever there's any kind of group project or organization, guess who's the only one not invited every single time? You guessed it, it's me! And they're not bullying me, it's because they know at a subconscious level that I'm not worth the dust beneath my paws, even the ones who have tried to deny this know it, and their actions prove it. Stop lying to me, the evidence is right in front of all of us! Not one thing I attempt ever finishes, and even if it would it'd be a huge mess and so much less than everyone else can do in a fraction of the time and effort. Now you may say, "Oh, I couldn't do what you did!". But you've never tried or been interested have you? Exactly. I don't and can't do even one thing halfway decently. Don't give me that 10000 hours crap or whatever, it hasn't worked at all for me and no one else even needs it. It's a myth, and even science has proven that, along with common sense. Practice accounts for maybe 0.1-10% of the difference, the rest is just innate intelligence that you have to be born with, not a fucking thing you can do about it. And everyone here has that in every field except me! I don't even know one other person who has this problem, I'm completely alone. Here everyone else is doing all sorts of crazy things and I can't even find a fox picture on the internet after searching for 2 hours with years of experience. I'm always out of the loop, super dull, can barely even think. I do a few things somewhat well but I'm faking it. They consist of a few specific things I've seen other people do and copying it robotically, with literally no understanding. I literally can't do anything else. Everyone else can at least do the thing they've been doing all the time for years, usually more than that, but me, nope, not even mediocre at one fucking thing! Not one hobby, not one game, not one subject, nothing! I'm uncharismatic, dull, forgetful, and just utterly incompetent! I'm a born loser, a wannabe in every way, and I just don't know how to play these cards! I get nothing but frustration and failure. This is so fucking unfair! The only thing I'm good at is burdening people with my problems. I used to have a some creativity at least when I was young but of course that went away as I got older and went through puberty and I can't ever even have that back! Damnit, what am I ever going to do with this situation! If I only knew even one other person on the whole planet who could sympathize with me. But no, you're all perfect and flawless and have superpowers compared to me, in real life and online. I need to give up on everything, my every effort is 100% in vain. But I'm not a passive consumer, and I can't just do that! Why am I like that when I don't have what it takes? I have no peace with myself, I can't just accept it, I don't want to waste my whole life in this miserable state. Someone please help me, I am falling apart! And please don't try to feed me more sugarcoated politically correct nonsense, that is not helping! Please, is there anything I can do escape this frustration and have joy in life?
post.title: Why am I the only one who isn't perfect?

body:
In reality, I don't think we actually are below average. I think we're actually above average for even doing anything at all. However, in my case, everyone I know is at the very very top of the pyramid who are the type that really can do anything they put their mind to. I don't know why that is, but I think it's because I have ambitions and similar personality to people who have real extraordinary potential. So I always land with them, being the outlier who doesn't have the extreme giftedness (among *them*, not everyone). Another explanation is that these people usually attain the highest social status, being natural leaders, while the masses are just more shy and tend to follow them around and not speak up much. So since I am an exception, being an active and present person who has more normal levels of giftedness, all the other active people are the ones who are on top of the world, and that's who I end up meeting. In addition, the other people often treat them like gods or idols and me talking to them more normally is probably why they get to know me better.

I suppose since we aren't talented enough to do things for ourselves, having fun is pretty much out of the question for us. However we can still enjoy other things we do have, if you have family, friends, a nice meal, cool stuff you bought, anything really, that's still an option. I really do have a surplus compared to a lot of people. Really immerse yourself in the things you do have and know that you're lucky to have them, and they could be taken away in the snap of a finger. It's not fair to only look at the most elite people in the world, even though to us (me at least) they're the whole world. But the vast majority of people aren't at that level, we just don't know them. All the people we know are just the lucky few who could become the next Einsteins or Beethovens or Picassos or Musks. And whatever the explanation is, try to find more people who aren't so great. That's been a real challenge for me but I found you, so that's something. Don't cut off contact with your old friends and abandon them, but try to cut off any way for you to find out what they're up to or accomplishing since it'll make you feel undermined. I recently unsubscribed from most of the guilds my friends post in for example, because my friends were making 1000000000000 excellent posts all the time and it was bothering me because I can't even make one. I may leave most discord servers too because I don't want to see how many gated projects they're all in that I was the only one not invited to, or how popular they became or what super privilege they attained somewhere, or what they made or did or whatever. I'll just talk to them in DMs and never ask what's happening elsewhere. I suppose only focus on what you do have, not what you don't. If you don't look at your friends' accomplishments, you'll stop thinking about how much better they're doing than you.

parent.body:
Sounds like we're twins or something. I know how it's like, no one is equal, and we just so happened to be born as people below average and there's nothing we can do about it. The only way I keep on going is pretty much trying to kill off my emotions, but even I still feel bad every now and then, no matter how hard I try not to feel like most people tell me, I've been trying for years and I'm still feeling upset I can't do what most people do and my subhuman status makes me undeserving of what most people have. But I do hope maybe one day you'll find something you can do, something you don't dread and is productive.

Also shameless advertising but there's always +Venting if you wanna let out anything there.

post.body: I HAVE FUCKING HAD IT! NOT **ONE** OTHER PERSON HERE HAS A SINGLE FAULT EXCEPT FOR ME! I can't do anything right. Even the smallest things I try to do fall apart immediately, and everyone else just keeps moving along achieving pretty much anything they want if they set their mind to it. Sure, they fail some, but at least not all the time! And I've had it with everyone trying to sugarcoat it and make it seem like it's not a big deal, because it is. Whenever there's any kind of group project or organization, guess who's the only one not invited every single time? You guessed it, it's me! And they're not bullying me, it's because they know at a subconscious level that I'm not worth the dust beneath my paws, even the ones who have tried to deny this know it, and their actions prove it. Stop lying to me, the evidence is right in front of all of us! Not one thing I attempt ever finishes, and even if it would it'd be a huge mess and so much less than everyone else can do in a fraction of the time and effort. Now you may say, "Oh, I couldn't do what you did!". But you've never tried or been interested have you? Exactly. I don't and can't do even *one thing* halfway decently. Don't give me that 10000 hours crap or whatever, it hasn't worked at all for me and no one else even needs it. It's a myth, and even science has proven that, along with common sense. Practice accounts for maybe 0.1-10% of the difference, the rest is just innate intelligence that you have to be born with, not a fucking thing you can do about it. And everyone here has that in every field except me! I don't even know *one* other person who has this problem, I'm completely alone. Here everyone else is doing all sorts of crazy things and I can't even find a fox picture on the internet after searching for 2 hours with years of experience. I'm always out of the loop, super dull, can barely even think. I do a few things somewhat well but I'm faking it. They consist of a few specific things I've seen other people do and copying it robotically, with literally no understanding. I literally can't do *anything* else. Everyone else can at least do the thing they've been doing all the time for years, usually more than that, but me, nope, not even mediocre at one fucking thing! Not one hobby, not one game, not one subject, nothing! I'm uncharismatic, dull, forgetful, and just utterly incompetent! I'm a born loser, a wannabe in every way, and I just don't know how to play these cards! I get nothing but frustration and failure. This is so fucking unfair! The only thing I'm good at is burdening people with my problems. I used to have a some creativity at least when I was young but of course that went away as I got older and went through puberty and I can't ever even have that back! Damnit, what am I ever going to do with this situation! If I only knew even one other person on the whole planet who could sympathize with me. But no, you're all perfect and flawless and have superpowers compared to me, in real life and online. I need to give up on everything, my every effort is 100% in vain. But I'm not a passive consumer, and I can't just do that! Why am I like that when I don't have what it takes? I have no peace with myself, I can't just accept it, I don't want to waste my whole life in this miserable state. Someone please help me, I am falling apart! And please don't try to feed me more sugarcoated politically correct nonsense, that is not helping! Please, is there anything I can do escape this frustration and have joy in life?

body: The problem is, I can't change everything about myself. And that includes the way I was born and what I'm capable of doing. I can no more give myself natural talent than I can turn into a dinosaur. I can change my attitude, but realizing I'm the problem doesn't mean I can solve it.

parent.body:
Sounds like you already accept and understand that you are your biggest problem? Now you just have to recognise that this understanding is in itself a superpower - more valuable than most others.

Most people live their entire lives believing they are the victim of some external, malevolent force that they are powerless to overcome. This is not the case.

If you are your biggest problem - the solution is within your control. Change your perspective, change your life.

+Stoicism

body:
The resources we have available to us today on this matter are sparse. There's really no way to know for sure, most references to both everlasting punishment and annihilation are in either parables or symbolic writings. Some also describe fire and others a dark place of weeping, or being imprisoned. To make things even more confusing, there's also the second lake of fire that death and the original hell are thrown into. Not that it really matters, since either way you definitely don't want to end up with it.

However, for those interested there's a very old apocryphal document called the Revelation of Peter that describes life after death. In hell, it is not said to be a pit of literal fire, rather people must suffer the torment they caused people during their lives. This book was accepted in some early churches and rejected in others. There's also a section that claims they will all eventually be saved because of the prayers of the righteous, the latter part of which is a huge red flag to me that something's not right because it's the same concept as purgatory and buying your way into heaven. So I doubt it's legit myself, but in any case it still sheds light on an earlier concept of hell than what we have now.

We really can't be sure. A lot of the "fire" references are an allusion to either destruction or mass graves where bodies were endlessly cremated in those times, but there's also the story of the rich man who was in flames, and it's hard to tell which ones are literal vs symbolic. And everlasting punishment, including both the Revelation of Peter type ones and burning in a lake of fire, is quite similar to ancient pagan myths of the underworld, even referring to the place as *Hades* in most instances, so it might be allegorical. But again, it could also be that those pagan myths derived from the original jewish sources like how the flood did.

In any case, it's bad news.

The resources we have available to us today on this matter are sparse. There's really no way to know for sure, most references to both everlasting punishment and annihilation are in either parables or symbolic writings. Some also describe fire and others a dark place of weeping, or being imprisoned. To make things even more confusing, there's also the second lake of fire that death and the original hell are thrown into. Not that it really matters, since either way you definitely don't want to end up with it.

However, for those interested there's a very old apocryphal document called the Revelation of Peter that describes life after death. In hell, it is not said to be a pit of literal fire, rather people must suffer the torment they caused people during their lives. This book was accepted in some early churches and rejected in others. There's also a section that claims they will all eventually be saved because of the prayers of the righteous, the latter part of which is a huge red flag to me that something's not right because it's the same concept as purgatory and buying your way into heaven. So I doubt it's legit myself, but in any case it still sheds light on an earlier concept of hell than what we have now.

We really can't be sure. A lot of the "fire" references are an allusion to either destruction or mass graves where bodies were endlessly cremated in those times, but there's also the story of the rich man who was in flames, and it's hard to tell which ones are literal vs symbolic. And everlasting punishment, including both the Revelation of Peter type ones and burning in a lake of fire, is quite similar to ancient pagan myths of the underworld, even referring to the place as Hades in most instances, so it might be allegorical. But again, it could also be that those pagan myths derived from the original jewish sources like how the flood did.

In any case, it's bad news.

guild.description:
This guild is to serve as a communication medium for fellow believers. The bible is the ultimate source of authority for any and all doctrine or doctrinal disputes. Posts can be made questioning the validity/veracity of the bible itself, but in any conversation wherein the topic itself is not the legitimacy of the bible, then it is assumed to be correct and factual. How else can any foundation be established except if the bible is a source of truth? Is man's opinion above God's word?

To the greatest extent possible i will avoid all forms of censorship, even spam would ideally be dealt with by down-voting rather than deleting. There is no restriction on post-type (you can post whatever you want) aside from the obvious nono's like porn, spam, calls to violence, etc..

This guild is to serve as a communication medium for fellow believers. The bible is the ultimate source of authority for any and all doctrine or doctrinal disputes. Posts can be made questioning the validity/veracity of the bible itself, but in any conversation wherein the topic itself is not the legitimacy of the bible, then it is assumed to be correct and factual. How else can any foundation be established except if the bible is a source of truth? Is man's opinion above God's word?

To the greatest extent possible i will avoid all forms of censorship, even spam would ideally be dealt with by down-voting rather than deleting. There is no restriction on post-type (you can post whatever you want) aside from the obvious nono's like porn, spam, calls to violence, etc..
guild.name: JesusChrist

post.body:
Most people don't argue heaven after death, assuming they believe in anything after death, but many are less willing to accept hell, and in particular that it would be eternal, or unending. What follows are passages which I believe are relevant to the subject, and would help illuminate what hell is. 

Given that the most controversial component is whether the punishment be eternal, I am going to add emphasis to certain portions which address that specifically.

I have not kept back verses, so if you think there are other verses in scripture which say something other than what is being said here, please comment with them. When writing these posts I usually gather from two sources, one being my own notes, and another being openbible.info, which I find to be a good crowd sourced compilation of verses pertaining to various doctrines/topics. 

I will give more detail on my personal stance on the matter at the end. **Please, as you read through this, read through the passages in your own bible.** I often leave out verses to keep the post shorter. (I try to use '...' to indicate when I am skipping verses, in addition to the comma separated list at the beginning of each quote). It is also a good opportunity to identify any differences in doctrine between one bible version and another. Everything here is KJV.
_________________________________________________________________________________________________________

The matter is concisely summarized here by an angel of God speaking to Daniel:

>Daniel 12:2 - And many of them that sleep in the dust of the earth shall awake, some to everlasting life, and some to shame and **everlasting contempt.**

**Everlasting** is a word that is used fairly often with respect to hell; both in the old and new testament. Can you imagine how terrible a translation would have to be to mess this up? I accept that it is technically possible for the translations we have available to us to be corrupted, but until *that* can be shown, then must we not accept what the text says? lets see what else it says...

>John 5:28-29 - (28) Marvel not at this: for the hour is coming, in the which all that are in the graves shall hear his voice, (29) and shall come forth; **they that have done good, unto the resurrection of life; and they that have done evil, unto the resurrection of damnation.**

The above is documented as having been the words of Jesus himself.

>Matthew 10:28, 32-33 - (28) And fear not them which kill the body, but are not able to kill the soul: but rather fear him which is able to **destroy both soul and body in hell**. ... (32) Whosoever therefore shall confess me before men, him will I confess also before my Father which is in heaven. (33)  But whosoever shall deny me before men, him will I also deny before my Father which is in heaven. 

Some people use the above passage to justify the idea that hell is not eternal, since the soul is destroyed, and it uses the word destruction elsewhere as well, so this is not an isolated instance.

>Matthew 13:49-50 -  (49) So shall it be at the end of the world: the angels shall come forth, and sever the wicked from among the just, (50)  **and shall cast them into the furnace of fire**: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth. 

>Matthew 25:41,44-46 - (41) Then shall he say also unto them on the left hand, Depart from me, ye cursed, into **everlasting fire**, prepared for the devil and his angels: ... (44) Then shall they also answer him, saying, Lord, when saw we thee an hungred, or athirst, or a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and did not minister unto thee? (45) Then shall he answer them, saying, Verily I say unto you, Inasmuch as ye did it not to one of the least of these, ye did it not to me. (46) And these shall go away into **everlasting punishment**: but the righteous into life eternal.

>Mark 9:43-44 - (43) And if thy hand offend thee, cut it off: it is better for thee to enter into life maimed, than having two hands to go into hell, **into the fire that never shall be quenched**: (44) **Where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.**

>John 3:18,36 - (18) He that believeth on him is not condemned: but **he that believeth not is condemned already**, because he hath not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. ... (36) He that believeth on the Son hath everlasting life: and **he that believeth not the Son shall not see life; but the wrath of God abideth on him**.

Here the choices are everlasting life, or the wrath of God. Is this substantially more palpable than everlasting life and everlasting torment?

>2 Thessalonians 1:8-9 - (8)  In flaming fire taking vengeance on them that know not God, and that obey not the gospel of our Lord Jesus Christ: (9)  Who shall be punished with **everlasting destruction from the presence of the Lord, and from the glory of his power;**

Now, if we imagine earth as a place where both good and evil exists, where evil abounds, but where God still mitigates and protects, and then we shift to considering a world where God plays no part at all, what would that world look like? If the punishment of the wicked ultimately amounts to complete separation from God, what could be worse than that? what could be more torturous? If it is the distance to which we find ourselves separated from God which determines our level of torment, (in both this world and the next) then what would absolute separation result in?

>Jude 1:7 - Even as Sodom and Gomorrha, and the cities about them in like manner, giving themselves over to fornication, and going after strange flesh, are set forth for an example, suffering the vengeance of **eternal fire.**

>Revelation 14:11 - **And the smoke of their torment ascendeth up for ever and ever**: and they have no rest day nor night, who worship the beast and his image, and whosoever receiveth the mark of his name. 

>Revelation 20:10,15 - (10) And the devil that deceived them was cast into the lake of fire and brimstone, where the beast and the false prophet are, and **shall be tormented day and night for ever and ever.** (15) And whosoever was not found written in the book of life was cast into the lake of fire. 

>Revelation 21:7-8 - (7)  He that overcometh shall inherit all things; and I will be his God, and he shall be my son. (8)  **But the fearful, and unbelieving, and the abominable, and murderers, and whoremongers, and sorcerers, and idolaters, and all liars, shall have their part in the lake which burneth with fire and brimstone**: which is the second death.

_________________________________________________________________________________________________________

So now my thoughts; one thought is that even though the wicked may all go to the same place, the punishment they receive is still described as being commensurate with their crime:

>Luke 12:46-48 - (46) The lord of that servant will come in a day when he looketh not for him, and at an hour when he is not aware, and will cut him in sunder, and will appoint him his portion with the unbelievers. (47) And that servant, which knew his lord's will, and prepared not himself, neither did according to his will, shall be beaten with many stripes. (48) But he that knew not, and did commit things worthy of stripes, shall be beaten with few stripes. For unto whomsoever much is given, of him shall be much required: and to whom men have committed much, of him they will ask the more. 

>Matthew 10:14-15 - (14) And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear your words, when ye depart out of that house or city, shake off the dust of your feet. (15) Verily I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment, than for that city.

So maybe the homeless drunkard will have to endure 100°F, but those who are more Hitler-like will have to endure 125°F, and the anti-christ and Satan will have to endure 150°F. This is likely an over-simplification of the matter, but it is not hard to imagine that God's judgment is fair, and such fairness is indicated in numerous places in scripture.

As for the eternal part, I think it is worth considering that there will not be time, and I think this is what is being referenced when eternity is spoken of; and if there is no time, then wouldn't *any* time be *all* time? As in, if there is no time, how can there be a distinction made in the severity of the punishment as it relates to the length of how long one endures such punishment? What would make more sense, is that if the severity was determined not by the length of the punishment, but by the punishment itself. If you are sentenced to life in prison with a beating once per month, it probably wouldn't be such a bad experience overall. If the beating were once per week, it would be much worse, and if the beating were every day, it would be nigh intolerable.

In summary, having said all of that, it may be that the bible versions we have available to us are corrupted (there were times in the history of both Israel and the Roman Catholic church wherein access to God's word was restricted to the masses), and thus punishment may not be eternal but rather limited in duration, (after which the soul is destroyed and the individual ceases to experience anything); 

*however*, as the text reads, there's really no way around what is at least the potential for eternal punishment, except that maybe certain sorts of people are destroyed, and other more severe sinners are not destroyed, but rather tormented forever. I have serious reservations about this, but I don't rule anything out, given how limited my understanding is.

body:
> It's not a prerequisite for success - it just means success may be harder to obtain.

It absolutely is a prerequisite, and not having it means it's *impossible* to obtain. Me, and plenty of people, try as they might, can't ever do anything right, while others breeze along. Contrary to popular belief, practice and effort accounts for, at most, 25% of the difference in ability. That means, at a minimum, *75 percent* of what you can do is determined entirely by what natural talent you have (and a few other minor factors, like learning faster when you're younger). And that's just for side hobbies. For main hobbies and professions, practice and hard work only make about *1-10%* of the difference depending on the field. This definitely reflects my experience. So if you're not born to do it, there's absolutely no hope for you. "10000 hours" and "put your mind to it" only works for the people who have the talent, they just need to hone their skills. For everyone else, this effort works a little bit at first but then you hit a ceiling, and after that it's all in vain. You may be able to robotically copy a few of the methods of the talented people but you will *never* be able to do most of it on your own. Studies have confirmed that success, talent, social status, and intelligence are all almost entirely genetic and fixed at birth. So basically I'm screwed. I'll always have to get someone else to accomplish everything I want for me, which is undesirable for a number of reasons, namely not being able to enjoy it myself, and also loss of control. But others will always be able to do almost anything they want all by themselves. It's not what anyone wants to hear, but unfortunately it's reality.

> Start with what you can control - your physical fitness... Routine - diet - working out. Stick to it for 30 days.

That's been going well for me so far, so that's a positive at least.

parent.body:
There is no necessity to change everything about yourself all at once... and so what if you have no natural talents? It's not a prerequisite for success - it just means success may be harder to obtain. 

Start with what you can control - your physical fitness... Routine - diet - working out. Stick to it for 30 days.

+Carnivore

post.body: I HAVE FUCKING HAD IT! NOT **ONE** OTHER PERSON HERE HAS A SINGLE FAULT EXCEPT FOR ME! I can't do anything right. Even the smallest things I try to do fall apart immediately, and everyone else just keeps moving along achieving pretty much anything they want if they set their mind to it. Sure, they fail some, but at least not all the time! And I've had it with everyone trying to sugarcoat it and make it seem like it's not a big deal, because it is. Whenever there's any kind of group project or organization, guess who's the only one not invited every single time? You guessed it, it's me! And they're not bullying me, it's because they know at a subconscious level that I'm not worth the dust beneath my paws, even the ones who have tried to deny this know it, and their actions prove it. Stop lying to me, the evidence is right in front of all of us! Not one thing I attempt ever finishes, and even if it would it'd be a huge mess and so much less than everyone else can do in a fraction of the time and effort. Now you may say, "Oh, I couldn't do what you did!". But you've never tried or been interested have you? Exactly. I don't and can't do even *one thing* halfway decently. Don't give me that 10000 hours crap or whatever, it hasn't worked at all for me and no one else even needs it. It's a myth, and even science has proven that, along with common sense. Practice accounts for maybe 0.1-10% of the difference, the rest is just innate intelligence that you have to be born with, not a fucking thing you can do about it. And everyone here has that in every field except me! I don't even know *one* other person who has this problem, I'm completely alone. Here everyone else is doing all sorts of crazy things and I can't even find a fox picture on the internet after searching for 2 hours with years of experience. I'm always out of the loop, super dull, can barely even think. I do a few things somewhat well but I'm faking it. They consist of a few specific things I've seen other people do and copying it robotically, with literally no understanding. I literally can't do *anything* else. Everyone else can at least do the thing they've been doing all the time for years, usually more than that, but me, nope, not even mediocre at one fucking thing! Not one hobby, not one game, not one subject, nothing! I'm uncharismatic, dull, forgetful, and just utterly incompetent! I'm a born loser, a wannabe in every way, and I just don't know how to play these cards! I get nothing but frustration and failure. This is so fucking unfair! The only thing I'm good at is burdening people with my problems. I used to have a some creativity at least when I was young but of course that went away as I got older and went through puberty and I can't ever even have that back! Damnit, what am I ever going to do with this situation! If I only knew even one other person on the whole planet who could sympathize with me. But no, you're all perfect and flawless and have superpowers compared to me, in real life and online. I need to give up on everything, my every effort is 100% in vain. But I'm not a passive consumer, and I can't just do that! Why am I like that when I don't have what it takes? I have no peace with myself, I can't just accept it, I don't want to waste my whole life in this miserable state. Someone please help me, I am falling apart! And please don't try to feed me more sugarcoated politically correct nonsense, that is not helping! Please, is there anything I can do escape this frustration and have joy in life?

body:
Yeah, Republican-infested protestantism is bullshit too, but what about the original that came before the RCC? It's the only thing worthy imo.

> Who compiled and canonized your Bible?

Well I've done quite a bit of research and I am confident that most of it was written by reputable sources. But the content is self-evident regardless.

> Do you believe in the satanic trinity abomination?

Yes, and how is it a satanic abomination?

> Do you believe Jesus is fully God and fully man?

Yes

> Which form of Christianity do you follow?

No denomination, because that means your allegiance is to that denomination instead. Church gatherings are important but there's been WAY too much emphasis on it ever since the Romans invaded Christianity, and serious structural changes too (mostly the sit down and be quiet and listen to the priest stuff). It's mostly just another excuse for centralization of power by a person or secular organization.

> And anyone that worship the satanic triad-idol and a human being as God is too.

I agree that the Romans corrupted it, but that is not one of the things they did. While it is true that earlier bibles omit some references to the trinity, many others are not. Even in the old testament it's described. And besides, why would they bother doing that? It wouldn't help them further their agenda, so that'd be a rather silly thing to change. More suspicious are statements made randomly smack in the middle of other passages that just so happen to justify the beliefs of the Roman Empire, like 1 Corinthians 13:34-35.

post.body: I HAVE FUCKING HAD IT! NOT **ONE** OTHER PERSON HERE HAS A SINGLE FAULT EXCEPT FOR ME! I can't do anything right. Even the smallest things I try to do fall apart immediately, and everyone else just keeps moving along achieving pretty much anything they want if they set their mind to it. Sure, they fail some, but at least not all the time! And I've had it with everyone trying to sugarcoat it and make it seem like it's not a big deal, because it is. Whenever there's any kind of group project or organization, guess who's the only one not invited every single time? You guessed it, it's me! And they're not bullying me, it's because they know at a subconscious level that I'm not worth the dust beneath my paws, even the ones who have tried to deny this know it, and their actions prove it. Stop lying to me, the evidence is right in front of all of us! Not one thing I attempt ever finishes, and even if it would it'd be a huge mess and so much less than everyone else can do in a fraction of the time and effort. Now you may say, "Oh, I couldn't do what you did!". But you've never tried or been interested have you? Exactly. I don't and can't do even *one thing* halfway decently. Don't give me that 10000 hours crap or whatever, it hasn't worked at all for me and no one else even needs it. It's a myth, and even science has proven that, along with common sense. Practice accounts for maybe 0.1-10% of the difference, the rest is just innate intelligence that you have to be born with, not a fucking thing you can do about it. And everyone here has that in every field except me! I don't even know *one* other person who has this problem, I'm completely alone. Here everyone else is doing all sorts of crazy things and I can't even find a fox picture on the internet after searching for 2 hours with years of experience. I'm always out of the loop, super dull, can barely even think. I do a few things somewhat well but I'm faking it. They consist of a few specific things I've seen other people do and copying it robotically, with literally no understanding. I literally can't do *anything* else. Everyone else can at least do the thing they've been doing all the time for years, usually more than that, but me, nope, not even mediocre at one fucking thing! Not one hobby, not one game, not one subject, nothing! I'm uncharismatic, dull, forgetful, and just utterly incompetent! I'm a born loser, a wannabe in every way, and I just don't know how to play these cards! I get nothing but frustration and failure. This is so fucking unfair! The only thing I'm good at is burdening people with my problems. I used to have a some creativity at least when I was young but of course that went away as I got older and went through puberty and I can't ever even have that back! Damnit, what am I ever going to do with this situation! If I only knew even one other person on the whole planet who could sympathize with me. But no, you're all perfect and flawless and have superpowers compared to me, in real life and online. I need to give up on everything, my every effort is 100% in vain. But I'm not a passive consumer, and I can't just do that! Why am I like that when I don't have what it takes? I have no peace with myself, I can't just accept it, I don't want to waste my whole life in this miserable state. Someone please help me, I am falling apart! And please don't try to feed me more sugarcoated politically correct nonsense, that is not helping! Please, is there anything I can do escape this frustration and have joy in life?

body: There's a lot of apostate beliefs these days that are founded on tradition (a type of sand) rather than faith (rock). For example, people go to church on Sundays and pray before meals because that's what people have always done. It's less because they actually believe and more nostalgia for the "good old days". This leads to a strict attitude of "new bad old good" followed with little sense. So they end up following some erroneous medieval and pagan beliefs just because they're seen as more traditional. This is a very large portion of churches and it's why outsiders usually see conservatism and Christianity as interchangeable. Tl;dr, they're not true believers, just fond traditionalists.

Here everyone else is doing all sorts of crazy things and I can't even find a fox picture on the internet after searching for 2 hours with years of experience. I'm always out of the loop, super dull, can barely even think. I do a few things somewhat well but I'm faking it. They consist of a few specific things I've seen other people do and copying it robotically, with literally no understanding. I literally can't do *anything* else. Everyone else can at least do the thing they've been doing all the time for years, usually more than that, but me, nope, not even mediocre at one fucking thing! Not one hobby, not one game, not one subject, nothing! I'm uncharismatic, dull, forgetful, and just utterly incompetent! I'm a born loser, a wannabe in every way, and I just don't know how to play these cards! I get nothing but frustration and failure. This is so fucking unfair! The only thing I'm good at is burdening people with my problems. I used to have a some creativity at least when I was young but of course that went away as I got older and went through puberty and I can't ever even have that back! Damnit, what am I ever going to do with this situation! If I only knew even one other person on the whole planet who could sympathize with me. But no, you're all perfect and flawless and have superpowers compared to me, in real life and online. I need to give up on everything, my every effort is 100% in vain. But I'm not a passive consumer, and I can't just do that! Why am I like that when I don't have what it takes? I have no peace with myself, I can't just accept it, I don't want to waste my whole life in this miserable state. Someone please help me, I am falling apart! And please don't try to feed me more sugarcoated politically correct nonsense, that is not helping! Please, is there anything I can do escape this frustration and have joy in life?

body:
I'm not exactly an outcast but everyone I know is worth infinitely more than me. They're all at the very top leading everything and people all listening to them and I've always been a nobody who no one takes seriously. Even people I know keep me out of more "important" things because I'm not worthy of it. So I can still relate to that.

But don't cut anyone off anymore. I have a friend who did that and he's even more miserable now, and he's just blank and doesn't exist. Before, he could still savor the good he had in life, but now he gave all that up and only suffers the bad things. You may not have as much of an abundance of luck and success as everyone else, but don't waste what you do have. And please don't abandon your friends, that's just selfish. If you can't stand to be around them at least call them or text them where you can be isolated from whatever amazing things they're doing.

parent.body: I'm probably still below average then because I don't really do anything, and when I do it's not as great. Remember when I said I'm undeserving of things others have? Well having friends and all that is too late for me. Several years ago I cut everyone off and I made no effort to befriend anyone, I never learned to communicate properly and I have a bland life, so trying to force anyone to talk to me would be extremely selfish. I even got ran out of one discord server for not having a job because of how socially unacceptable that is. I only have online friends who despite me a horrible person, they still want to talk to me anyway. But I have noticed they're all social rejects as well, a common theme among them most people think they're awful people. Like me. And since I don't have a job I can't buy things for myself, all I have is to sit around and stare at my screen as a way escape my reality. But that's much more difficult compared to a year ago, as internet is now heavily tied to real life it seems.

Even the smallest things I try to do fall apart immediately, and everyone else just keeps moving along achieving pretty much anything they want if they set their mind to it. And they're not bullying me, it's because they know at a subconscious level that I'm not worth the dust beneath my paws, even the ones who have tried to deny this know it, and their actions prove it. Stop lying to me, the evidence is right in front of all of us! Not one thing I attempt ever finishes, and even if it would it'd be a huge mess and so much less than everyone else can do in a fraction of the time and effort. Not one hobby, not one game, not one subject, nothing! I'm uncharismatic, dull, forgetful, and just utterly incompetent! I'm a born loser, a wannabe in every way, and I just don't know how to play these cards! I get nothing but frustration and failure. This is so fucking unfair! The only thing I'm good at is burdening people with my problems. body: It's fake because I can mimick a specific exact process from someone who's actually good at something, but I could never come up with it on my own, which if I want to build my own things is necessary. For example I can score very high in math because I copy exactly how someone else does the problems. But if I wanted to be a mathematician where I actually have to figure things out and think outside the box even a little, it's game over. Then I could learn from others who actually are good how to solve something, and I could then be able to solve those exact type of problems, but never do it myself like they can, which is an essential skill to be able to actually do things on your own. A silly example, but one I figure most people can understand. So I'm actually really stupid and bad at everything, I just tend to systematically copy what the actually smart people do so it *looks* like I'm smarter than I am, but it wasn't really me who did any of the thinking or the work behind it.

Whenever there's any kind of group project or organization, guess who's the only one not invited every single time? You guessed it, it's me! And they're not bullying me, it's because they know at a subconscious level that I'm not worth the dust beneath my paws, even the ones who have tried to deny this know it, and their actions prove it. Stop lying to me, the evidence is right in front of all of us! Not one thing I attempt ever finishes, and even if it would it'd be a huge mess and so much less than everyone else can do in a fraction of the time and effort. Now you may say, "Oh, I couldn't do what you did!". But you've never tried or been interested have you? Exactly. I don't and can't do even one thing halfway decently. Don't give me that 10000 hours crap or whatever, it hasn't worked at all for me and no one else even needs it. It's a myth, and even science has proven that, along with common sense. Practice accounts for maybe 0.1-10% of the difference, the rest is just innate intelligence that you have to be born with, not a fucking thing you can do about it. And everyone here has that in every field except me! I don't even know one other person who has this problem, I'm completely alone. Here everyone else is doing all sorts of crazy things and I can't even find a fox picture on the internet after searching for 2 hours with years of experience. I'm always out of the loop, super dull, can barely even think. I do a few things somewhat well but I'm faking it. They consist of a few specific things I've seen other people do and copying it robotically, with literally no understanding. I literally can't do anything else. Everyone else can at least do the thing they've been doing all the time for years, usually more than that, but me, nope, not even mediocre at one fucking thing! Not one hobby, not one game, not one subject, nothing! I'm uncharismatic, dull, forgetful, and just utterly incompetent! I'm a born loser, a wannabe in every way, and I just don't know how to play these cards! I get nothing but frustration and failure. This is so fucking unfair! The only thing I'm good at is burdening people with my problems. I used to have a some creativity at least when I was young but of course that went away as I got older and went through puberty and I can't ever even have that back! Damnit, what am I ever going to do with this situation! If I only knew even one other person on the whole planet who could sympathize with me. But no, you're all perfect and flawless and have superpowers compared to me, in real life and online. I need to give up on everything, my every effort is 100% in vain. But I'm not a passive consumer, and I can't just do that! Why am I like that when I don't have what it takes? I have no peace with myself, I can't just accept it, I don't want to waste my whole life in this miserable state. Someone please help me, I am falling apart! And please don't try to feed me more sugarcoated politically correct nonsense, that is not helping! Please, is there anything I can do escape this frustration and have joy in life?
post.title: Why am I the only one who isn't perfect?
